titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1645: Traité de la mignature et de plusieurs secrets pour différens usage

notesStmt.note: Title from title page (p. i recto); caption title, Traitè de la mignature et d'autres matiéres curieuses pour la peinture, pratiquées et tirées des meilleurs auteurs modernes (p. 1); spine title Trait. de la migna.

msContents.summary: 18th-century copy of a technical treatise on the painting of miniatures, in print from 1673. Includes information on the reduction of images and mixes of pigments for landscapes, skies, varieties of flowers, skin, faces, drapery, and jewels. Slightly more than half the manuscript (through p. 138) closely matches early printed editions; the remainder of the text presents material from other sources, including preparations and uses of gold leaf, varnish, lacquer, and gold and silver inks, and instructions for marbling paper and tinting parchment.

msItem.title: Traité de la mignature et de plusieurs secrets pour différens usage
msItem.author: Boutet, Claude,

supportDesc.extent: 111 leaves : 155 x 100 (117 x 67) mm bound to 166 x 108 mm

collation.p: Paper, 111; 1²(-1) 2-13⁸ 14⁸(-2, one glued to endpaper); [i-ii], 1-220, contemporary pagination in ink, upper center.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 22-23 long lines; vertical margins marked by folding.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in cursive script by a single hand.

binding.p: Contemporary mottled sheep with gilt paneled spine (Croft), with spine title Trait. de la migna.

origin.p: Written in Nancy, France, completed 1 September 1744 (p. 208).

history.provenance: Sold by Justin Croft Antiquarian Books (Kent, England), catalog 8 (2014), no. 3.

keywords.term: Illumination of books and manuscripts--Early works to 1800
